title: Matrices - rows and columns to define products

content.question: Matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrix of real numbers, and matrix <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is an <math alttext="r by c"><mi>r</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>c</mi></math> matrix of real numbers. The product <math alttext="A B"><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> is defined, but the product <math alttext="B A"><mi>B</mi><mi>A</mi></math> is not defined. Of the following, which could be the values of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
